results.title: You promised me gold
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
This is one of eight programs that look at different athletes preparing themselves for the Commonwealth Games of 1982. Alex Baumann, the athlete studied in this program, is a swimmer who is training for the Games despite a nagging shoulder injury that has prevented him from participating in other competitions.

results.title: Bertland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
The fastest 400 metre runner in the world in 1982 was Bertland Cameron from Spanish Town, Jamaica. Bert is studying at the University of Texas, at El Paso, and is there on an athletics scholarship which requires him to perform at his top if he wants to keep it. The pressure, and the tension it brings, continues as he prepares for the 400 metres final at the 1982 Brisbane Commonwealth Games.

results.title: The Bank of England
results.creator_credit: Derek Williams, Ian Dalrymple and Wessex Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the many aspects of the Bank’s life; the traditions and premises, the hierarchy and staff; meetings of the Court and committees; the work of certain departments such as the printing works. An intricate machine and the people who operate it have been skillfully photographed. Includes the Guard, the Sports Club, and the exterior of several branches. Indirectly the historical aspects are portrayed.

results.title: The Banjo and the bard
results.brief_description: A poetic debate between Banjo Paterson and Henry Lawson ran over several weeks in the Bulletin magazine of the 1890s. The subject of the debate was the Australian bush. Paterson, who spent most of his life in more affluent surroundings than Lawson, saw the bush as a place of romance and adventure. Lawson saw only the hardship and struggle. To earn themselves some money they convinced the Bulletin to print the poems they each wrote disclaiming the other’s point-of-view. The story is filmed entirely in contemporary settings with Paterson and Lawson, in their period costume, as the only references to the time-frame of the Bulletin articles.

results.title: Marathon
results.creator_credit: Bruce Ezard, Dennis O'Rourke, Graham Chase, Nick Torrens and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Striving”.
Robert de Castella is one of the top marathon runners in the world today and this film is about the preparation that led to his gold medal at the 1982 Commonwealth Games. The film includes personal films and snapshots that show de Castella’s early running career. These also give us an idea of how he developed the physical and mental stamina that a marathon demands.

results.title: Mountains of change
results.creator_credit: Peter Hicks, Peter Beilby and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Using archival footage, interviews and dramatic reconstruction, this program presents a comprehensive history of skiing in Australia from its beginnings last century to the booming tourist industry it has become today.

results.title: The Barretts of Wimpole Street
results.creator_credit: Sidney A. Franklin, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A dramatic portrayal of the romance of poets, Elizabeth Barrett (Jennifer Jones) and Robert Browning (Bill Travers). The invalid poetess who regains her health after falling in love with the famous poet elopes with the poet against the wishes of her tyrannical father (John Gielgud), who exhibits an incestuous attachment for Elizabeth, as well as an over domineering control of all the Barrett siblings in their personal adult relationships. The story is set in London, England, starting in the year, 1845. Cast also includes Virginia McKenna, Susan Stephen, Vernon Gray.

results.title: Working work out
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Changing Australia”.
This is a documentary about unemployment and the resulting social implications in the Newcastle and Wollongong area, which has experienced a downturn in the steel industries.

results.title: The Barbarian and the geisha (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Eugene Frenke and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1856 American Governor Harris became the first foreign diplomat to visit the Forbidden Empire of Japan. This semi-historical romance stars John Wayne as the diplomat engaged in hostile trade talks with the Japanese government, who finds himself falling in love with a beautiful geisha. Huston has directed a finely crafted tale of adventure and intrigue. The production was filmed entirely in Japan.
